title: Dream Archive Adventure #1
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Memory Vault
rooms.description: A circular chamber with walls lined with glowing crystalline shelves. Each shelf holds a floating orb containing a captured dream. The air shimmers with ethereal light, and whispers of forgotten memories echo softly. A large filing cabinet stands against one wall, and a locked dream container sits on a pedestal in the center.

items.name: dream filing cabinet
items.description: A tall cabinet with three drawers labeled with strange symbols

items.name: archivist's log
items.description: A glowing document written in shifting text
items.text: Archive Entry: The Dreamer's most vivid memory occurred on May 28th (5/28). This date unlocks the middle drawer. Remember: The Dreamer is named Luna Winters, keeper of the Nightmare Fragment and the Hope Shard.

items.name: crystalline silver key
items.description: A key made of solidified moonlight that hums with dream energy

items.name: sealed dream container
items.description: A glass sphere containing swirling mist, locked with a silver mechanism

items.name: Nightmare Fragment
items.description: A dark crystal shard pulsing with shadowy energy, one of the artifacts needed to escape

items.name: crystalline memory shelves
items.description: Shelves holding countless dream orbs, each containing a captured memory

items.name: Dreamer's journal
items.description: A leather-bound journal that writes itself with dream entries
items.text: Journal Entry: I am Luna Winters, and I've been trapped in the Dream Archive for what feels like eternity. To escape, I must gather the Nightmare Fragment and the Hope Shard, then pass through the Corridor of Forgotten Dreams to reach the Reality Portal. The Sanctuary of Lost Thoughts holds the final key.

items.name: shimmering doorway
items.description: A doorway made of liquid light leading deeper into the archive

rooms.name: Corridor of Forgotten Dreams
rooms.description: A long hallway where the walls constantly shift and change, displaying fragments of half-remembered dreams. Ghostly figures walk past, replaying moments from forgotten memories. Three large murals dominate the walls, each depicting a different scene. At the end of the corridor stands an ornate door covered in question marks.

items.name: mural of childhood
items.description: A painting showing a young girl playing in a garden
items.text: Mural inscription: 'The Dreamer's first memory - playing in the Sanctuary of Lost Thoughts, where innocence dwells forever.'

items.name: mural of nightmares
items.description: A dark painting depicting shadowy creatures and fears
items.text: Mural inscription: 'The Dreamer's greatest fear - being forgotten and lost in the Void of Memories, where names disappear.'

items.name: mural of hope
items.description: A bright painting showing a figure reaching toward light
items.text: Mural inscription: 'The Dreamer's deepest wish - to wake and return to reality, to remember who they truly are.'

items.name: floating dream chest
items.description: A chest suspended in mid-air, glowing with warm golden light

items.name: Hope Shard
items.description: A brilliant crystal fragment radiating warmth and light, the second artifact needed to escape

items.name: scattered memory fragments
items.description: Glowing shards of broken memories floating in the air

items.name: fragment of identity
items.description: A piece of memory containing crucial information
items.text: Memory Fragment: You are Luna Winters. You must remember this. Your first memory was in the Sanctuary of Lost Thoughts. You fear the Void of Memories above all else.

items.name: door to reality
items.description: An ornate door covered in swirling question marks. A plaque reads: 'Only those who know themselves may pass.'

password_questions.question: What is the Dreamer's name?
password_questions.hint: Check the archivist's note and the identity fragment

password_questions.question: Where was the Dreamer's first memory?
password_questions.hint: Read the mural of childhood carefully

password_questions.question: What is the Dreamer's greatest fear?
password_questions.hint: The mural of nightmares reveals this

rooms.name: Reality Portal Chamber
rooms.description: You have reached the heart of the Dream Archive! A massive swirling portal of light and color dominates the room, showing glimpses of the waking world beyond. Two pedestals stand before the portal, each with an empty socket waiting for a dream artifact. The air crackles with the energy of transition between dreams and reality.

items.name: twin artifact pedestals
items.description: Two crystalline pedestals with sockets shaped for the Nightmare Fragment and Hope Shard
items.text: Inscription: 'Balance the darkness and light. Place both artifacts to activate the portal and return to reality.'

items.name: reality portal
items.description: A magnificent portal showing the waking world. It requires both dream artifacts to fully activate.

rooms.name: The Waking World
rooms.description: You open your eyes and find yourself in a comfortable bed, sunlight streaming through the window. The Dream Archive fades like morning mist. You are awake, you are real, and you remember everything. The adventure through your own archived dreams has come to an end.

items.name: bedroom window
items.description: A window showing the real world outside - trees, sky, and the promise of a new day

rooms.win_message: You have successfully navigated the Dream Archive and returned to reality! The Nightmare Fragment and Hope Shard merge into a single memory crystal that you hold in your hand - a reminder that you conquered your own subconscious. You are awake, you are Luna Winters, and you are free. You win!
